title: Navigation Bar Sticky and Link Functionality
description: Verify that the navigation bar remains fixed at the top of the viewport during scrolling and all navigation links route correctly to their sections.

steps.description: Load the workshop main page in a web browser.
Check that the navigation bar is visible and fixed at the top on initial load.
Scroll down the page.
Confirm the navigation bar remains sticky and always visible during scrolling.
Click each navigation link in the bar.
Validate that clicking each link scrolls or navigates to the corresponding section accurately.

title: Weekly Curriculum Tab Buttons Functionality
description: Ensure that each weekly tab button toggles the display of detailed curriculum content correctly and visually distinguishes the selected tab.

steps.description: Open the curriculum section in the workshop page.
Click on each weekly tab button sequentially.
Verify that only the selected week's curriculum details are displayed and other weeks' details are hidden.
Check that the active tab button is visually highlighted according to the design.

title: Interactive Translation Demo Accuracy and Simulation
description: Validate the simulated AI translation that converts artist's abstract language inputs into administrative review-oriented language accurately, reflecting expected transformations.

steps.description: Navigate to the interactive translation demo section.
Input sample artist language text representative of abstract artistic expressions.
Trigger the translation function.
Verify the output text is a logical, structured administrative language version matching the intended transformation.
Input empty or non-meaningful text and trigger translation.
Check graceful handling with appropriate messages or fallback without errors.

title: Workshop Application Modal Form Input Validation and Submission
description: Test the modal form that collects user personal information, AI experience, and expectations for correct input validations and successful submission handling.

steps.description: Click the modal trigger button on the navigation bar to open the workshop application form.
Confirm the modal appears and is focused.
Enter valid personal information, AI experience details, and user expectations.
Submit the form.
Verify form submission processes successfully and confirmation or success message appears.
Open the modal again, enter invalid data (e.g., missing required fields, invalid formats).
Attempt to submit the form.
Check that appropriate validation error messages appear and submission is blocked.

title: Chart.js Evaluation Criteria Data Visualization Accuracy and Responsiveness
description: Verify that the Chart.js rendered chart accurately displays evaluation data, updates correctly if data changes, and responds well to different screen sizes.

steps.description: Load the evaluation criteria chart section on the page.
Confirm the chart is rendered correctly with data points matching the predefined criteria.
Resize the browser window to various dimensions including mobile viewport sizes.
Ensure the chart layout and labels adjust properly and remain fully visible and legible.
Simulate data update in the chart (if supported) and render again.
Check that the chart updates dynamically to reflect new data without visual errors.

title: Overall UI Consistency with Tailwind CSS Styling
description: Confirm the entire user interface adheres uniformly to Tailwind CSS styling standards providing consistent, intuitive, and visually appealing user experience.

steps.description: Navigate through all pages and interactive elements including navigation bar, tabs, translation demo, modal forms, and charts.
Check consistent usage of Tailwind CSS classes for spacing, typography, colors, and responsive design.
Verify that visual components have consistent margins, padding, font sizes, and color schemes across the application.

title: Modal Accessibility and Keyboard Navigation
description: Verify that the workshop application modal form supports keyboard accessibility and screen readers for inclusive user experience.

steps.description: Open the workshop application modal using keyboard navigation (e.g., Tab and Enter keys).
Confirm the modal gains focus and keyboard input is directed properly within the modal.
Navigate through modal form fields completely using Tab and Shift+Tab keys.
Verify all interactive elements are reachable and usable via keyboard alone.
Attempt to close the modal using keyboard shortcuts (e.g., Escape key).
Ensure the modal closes correctly and focus returns to the triggering element.

title: Data Collection and Integrity Post Application Submission
description: Ensure that all user input data from the workshop application modal is collected correctly and submitted data integrity is maintained.

steps.description: Fill in the modal form with valid, complex inputs including special characters and long text entries.
Submit the form.
Validate that the data received on the backend or simulated backend matches exactly the user input.
Check for any data loss, truncation, or corruption.
Confirm that all fields are accurately captured and stored as expected.

title: Error Handling for Network or Submission Failures
description: Verify the system behavior when form submission fails due to network issues or server errors, ensuring informative feedback is provided to the user.

steps.description: Simulate network failure or backend service unavailability during modal form submission.
Submit the application form.
Check that a clear and user-friendly error message is displayed explaining the failure.
Ensure the form remains open allowing the user to retry submission without data loss.
